channel.title: Pradeo Blog
channel.description: Read about the lastest Mobile Security news and get tips to protect your enterprise mobile endpoints.

item.title: Temu, what to take away from this new controversy?
item.description:
In recent weeks, the Chinese application Temu has come under inspection, fueling the debate on the intrusive nature of certain applications and the risk of sensitive data exfiltration. 

With over 100 million downloads in the last 9 months in Europe and the United States, this ultra-competitive e-commerce application is challenging AliExpress and Shein and highlights the rapid adoption of mobile applications. 

The report published by the American company Grizzly Research last September raises concerns by suspecting Temu of massive data exfiltration, resembling espionage. The research firm invokes the precautionary principle and calls for the removal of the application, which could potentially harm the interests of the United States.
item.content:encoded:
In recent weeks, the Chinese application Temu has come under inspection, fueling the debate on the intrusive nature of certain applications and the risk of sensitive data exfiltration. 

With over 100 million downloads in the last 9 months in Europe and the United States, this ultra-competitive e-commerce application is challenging AliExpress and Shein and highlights the rapid adoption of mobile applications. 

The report published by the American company Grizzly Research last September raises concerns by suspecting Temu of massive data exfiltration, resembling espionage. The research firm invokes the precautionary principle and calls for the removal of the application, which could potentially harm the interests of the United States.
item.dc:creator: Caroline Borriello

item.title: SpyNote malware now targeting banking applications
item.description:
Since June, a surge of SpyNote infections targeting banking applications has been reported. A new version of the spyware distributed through email phishing or smishing (by SMS) campaigns is now specifically designed to commit banking fraud.

SpyNote is a family of dangerous Android malware, first sold on the dark web in 2021. After the source code was leaked in 2022, multiple variants came in circulation. The latest of these variants is targeting specifically financial institutions, such as HSBC, Deutsche Bank, Kotak Bank, BurlaNubank and Bank of America.
item.content:encoded:
Since June, a surge of SpyNote infections targeting banking applications has been reported. A new version of the spyware distributed through email phishing or smishing (by SMS) campaigns is now specifically designed to commit banking fraud.

SpyNote is a family of dangerous Android malware, first sold on the dark web in 2021. After the source code was leaked in 2022, multiple variants came in circulation. The latest of these variants is targeting specifically financial institutions, such as HSBC, Deutsche Bank, Kotak Bank, BurlaNubank and Bank of America.
item.author: roxane@pradeo.com (Roxane Suau)

item.title: Pradeo recognized in 2023 Gartner Peer Insights™ Voice of the Customer for Mobile Threat Defense
item.description:
Pradeo is proud to be recognized as a Strong Performer in recent Gartner Peer Insights Voice of the Customer for Mobile Threat Defense report, published in July 2023. 

The excellent reviews received from Pradeo’s various customers, including CISOs, IT Security and Risk Managers, and Data Analysts, emphasize its objective to delivering reliable mobile endpoint detection and response, and underscore its dedication to technology efficiency and customer satisfaction.

item.title: Two spyware tied with China found hiding on the Google Play Store
item.description: This week, our engine detected two spyware hiding on the Google Play Store and affecting up to 1.5 million users. Both applications are from the same developer, pose as file management applications and feature similar malicious behaviors. They are programmed to launch without users’ interaction, and to silently exfiltrate sensitive users’ data towards various malicious servers based in China. We have alerted Google of the discovery before publishing this alert.
item.content:encoded: This week, our engine detected two spyware hiding on the Google Play Store and affecting up to 1.5 million users. Both applications are from the same developer, pose as file management applications and feature similar malicious behaviors. They are programmed to launch without users’ interaction, and to silently exfiltrate sensitive users’ data towards various malicious servers based in China. We have alerted Google of the discovery before publishing this alert.
item.author: roxane@pradeo.com (Roxane Suau)

item.title: Pradeo launches unmatched benefits for MSSPs with its latest Mobile Threat Defense release
item.description: While mobile users are increasingly falling victims of cybercriminals, organizations are raising their spending in mobile endpoint detection and response solutions (Mobile EDR). To tackle these new cybersecurity threats, they are turning to their Managed Security Service Providers (MSSPs) to upgrade their scope into covering mobile security. Pradeo’s newest version of its Mobile Threat Defense (MTD) solution offers turnkey features designed to smoothly blend with MSSPs existing offering and drastically cut down administration time.
item.content:encoded: While mobile users are increasingly falling victims of cybercriminals, organizations are raising their spending in mobile endpoint detection and response solutions (Mobile EDR). To tackle these new cybersecurity threats, they are turning to their Managed Security Service Providers (MSSPs) to upgrade their scope into covering mobile security. Pradeo’s newest version of its Mobile Threat Defense (MTD) solution offers turnkey features designed to smoothly blend with MSSPs existing offering and drastically cut down administration time.
item.author: roxane@pradeo.com (Roxane Suau)

item.title: Smartphones and tablets : An open door to ransomwares
item.description: The FBI's Internet Crime Complaint Center reported recently a 62% year-over-year increase of ransomware attacks. At a time when we hear more often than ever about this threat in the global media, it should be noted that ransomwares are not new, but currently gaining a lot of popularity among cybercriminals.
item.content:encoded: The FBI's Internet Crime Complaint Center reported recently a 62% year-over-year increase of ransomware attacks. At a time when we hear more often than ever about this threat in the global media, it should be noted that ransomwares are not new, but currently gaining a lot of popularity among cybercriminals.
item.dc:creator: Romain Chassere

item.title: Why is phishing so efficient on mobile?
item.description:
Phishing is a hacking technique that makes a user believe that he is interacting with the interface of a trusted third party (his bank, an administration, a well-known company...) in order to exfiltrate personal information such as his password, credit card numbers, social security number, etc.

A phishing campaign is characterized, from the hacker's perspective, by the simplicity of its execution associated with the possibility to lead a large-scale attack. Although it originated in the 1990s, this type of attack is still very common today.
item.content:encoded:
Phishing is a hacking technique that makes a user believe that he is interacting with the interface of a trusted third party (his bank, an administration, a well-known company...) in order to exfiltrate personal information such as his password, credit card numbers, social security number, etc.

item.title: How to strengthen your cybersecurity posture by automating mobile security?
item.description: The constant growth and diversification of cyber threats is making them tedious to manage. When faced with thousands of daily security alerts, cybersecurity teams may not be able to manually respond to each one in an optimal timeframe.
item.content:encoded: The constant growth and diversification of cyber threats is making them tedious to manage. When faced with thousands of daily security alerts, cybersecurity teams may not be able to manually respond to each one in an optimal timeframe.
item.author: roxane@pradeo.com (Roxane Suau)

item.title: TikTok, a leakware installed on 2 billion mobile devices
item.description: Over the past two weeks, the White House, Canada, the European Union and several countries in Europe have banned the use of the mobile application TikTok by their members and agencies.
item.content:encoded: Over the past two weeks, the White House, Canada, the European Union and several countries in Europe have banned the use of the mobile application TikTok by their members and agencies.
item.author: roxane@pradeo.com (Roxane Suau)

item.title: Discovery of a vulnerability in one of the world's largest open source catalogs
item.description: Pradeo's source code analysis and secure coding tool has enabled the discovery of a vulnerability in the code of a popular open source library. Freely available to download by the community, this interface module designed to leave comments contained a flaw that allowed privilege escalation.
item.content:encoded: Pradeo's source code analysis and secure coding tool has enabled the discovery of a vulnerability in the code of a popular open source library. Freely available to download by the community, this interface module designed to leave comments contained a flaw that allowed privilege escalation.
